comments:
The exception below is thrown when defining the attached profile inside the
sample UML2 editor. If you delete the generalization, the "Define" action works
fine.

This also worked fine with UML2 1.0.2.

Created an attachment (id=27070)
The sample profile.

It is not valid for a stereotype to specialize anything other than another 
stereotype (i.e. it cannot specialize a metaclass); if this worked before, it 
was unintentional. Regardless, the exception should be avoided.
The fix has been committed to CVS.
The fix is available in build M200509151108.

traces.message: An exception was ignored during command execution
